data.title: Dissapointment in what was once a nice place
data.text: We arrived at the restaurant for dinner on a weekday. The restaurant was only about half full. We were seated in the bar area by the hostess. We sat and sat and waited and waited and no one ever came to the table. No water, no drink orders, I mean nobody. We ended up just getting up and leaving.Sad that this franchise seems to be slipping. We visited the restaurant in Ft. Worth numerous times and always enjoyed it. However, the location in Mansfield also has horrible customer service (long waits when the place is empty) and this location seems to be following suit. Won't be returning.

data.title: Interesting Pizza Combinations
data.text: I recently went to Mellow Mushroom for the first time with my fiance. We each had or own pizza and had some left over to take home. He had the meat lovers pizza and was pleased with it. I had the thai dye pizza which was the perfect combination of sweet, spicy, and savory. This pizza mixes thai curry chicken, peanut sauce and sweet chili sauce. I would definitely recommend to locals.

data.title: friends dinner
data.text: I find it difficult to see how anyone  rates this above two stars.  The service is terrible and the food eatable at best.   The restaurant was not busy with several empty tables.  After waiting 30 minutes for the pizza ,the rest of the order arrived twenty minutes later, these were a crumbed sausage sandwich,meatball and shrimp sandwiches.  The shrimp were very over cooked and the sausage was burnt. I think they need some adult management at this location.

data.title: Mellow Mushroom
data.text: Great pizza, regardless of what you like on it.  They have it all.  My favorite has curry on it!!  I've seen so many different types of pizza offered there you just can't lose out.  Prices are very good as well.

data.title: Maybe the disaster was a one-time thing but I won't return to find out
data.text: When our party of five arrived, we let our server know that we had tickets for the concert next door that was starting in just a little over an hour and we even ordered drinks while the fifth member of our party was still parking the car. Our drinks arrived 35 minutes after we sat down and only after we went to the bar to check on their progress. All around us other tables were being served both food and drinks. After our drinks finally arrived, we asked our server when the food would come. She returned five minutes later and told us it would be at least 25 minutes, meaning more than an hour after we had arrived and ordered and far too late to attend the concert next door. All the while other people were being serve, even people who were seated after us. Their food looked good but I will never find out the quality of food here because I will never return.

owner_response.author: Kim S, Owner at Mellow Mushroom, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello,
We are so sorry about your experience here.  It definitely sounds like you were waiting much longer than necessary, and I know that can be extremely frustrating, especially when you have somewhere to be after dinner.  I am very sorry that we dropped the ball.  Will you please contact us at arlington@mellowmushroominfo.com so that we can discuss the details of your visit further, and so that we can make this right?  Thank you in advance, and again, I apologize.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

This isn't fast food pizza.  You can tell the ingredients are a notch above.

data.title: Pretty good pizza
data.text: We were part of a group of three families who are here together at mid-afternoon on a Sunday.  The restaurant wasn't busy, but the service was still pretty spotty.  My drink remained empty during much of our meal, and my daughter, who was at the other end of the table from us, never had her drink order taken.  (We were finally able to get her a drink when our food came.)  Because of the layout, we couldn't see our two servers to try to get their attention when they weren't on the restaurant floor.  The pizza was pretty good but of the dry variety (very little tomato sauce) and is a little pricy.  We had an order of cheese bread (served with the tiniest possible cup of marinara), two one-topping medium pizzas, and four drinks, and our tab was almost $50.  I might go back but think I'd look at other local pizza options first.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: I've eaten here a few times in past years, but the last time was probably at least three years ago. I've always liked the restaurant, but I don't remember ever eating there and thinking, "This is really great pizza!" Yesterday I did. Thin crust but with thick, soft, and tasty outer edges, sprinkled with parmesan cheese. Crust that you'll want to eat every bite of. The main part of the pizza was great, too. Good-tasting cheese, toppings and sauce all blended together in the right amounts. We also had the french bread-style cheese bread as an appetizer. It was crispy yet soft, with a good amount of cheese, and served with a cup of pizza sauce for dipping. My wife and I visited with our 5-year-old grandson and he enjoyed it, which is always a plus. Fun and colorful decor. (Interesting suggestion from my grandson: With a large number of TVs visible everywhere, all on sports channels, he wondered why none of them had any kids shows on.) Overall, it was a very enjoyable dinner, and the food was the highlight. Definitely worth a try if you haven't tried it before, and maybe worth another try if you haven't been there lately.

data.title: Unpleasant experience
data.text:
Went to this restaurant at dinner hour.  Restaurant was almost empty which seemed strange at dinner hour.  Service was extremely slow.  Servers appeared to be hiding to avoid work.  The food was good although we found it difficult to enjoy because of all of the flies in the restaurant.  The manager came by and "assured" is that the exterminator Is scheduled for "tomorrow" and he expressed his hopes that we might come back at a later date when there aren't so many flies disturbing dinner.  

Based on our experience tonight (Wednesday) the only recommendation I can offer is to stay away.  There are plenty of restaurants in Arlington with well-trained staffs, timely service and clean dining rooms without insects
